title: resume
text:
contact details


Maciej Działo
scientist & data analyst
 Rzeszów, Poland
 maciejdzialo [at] gmail.com
or reach out via contact page →


    





summary


I am driven by continuous learning and self-improvement, constantly seeking to expand my skills and knowledge. My academic and publishing journey has taught me the importance of effective communication and problem-solving, always striving for optimal solutions.


As a scientist, I have enjoyed designing and analyzing research, ensuring its reproducibility, and crafting clear, data-driven narratives. I have honed my skills in advanced statistical and research methodologies.


I believe in the power of data to tell compelling stories and the value of simple, effective solutions. Embracing collaboration and innovation, I aim to help teams make smarter, data-driven decisions so that together we can contribute to a better future.




professional experience















02/2024 - ongoing


Freelance Data Analyst
















Frontiers


09/2023 - 06/2024


Publishing Specialist, Content


Remote, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Analyzed publishing market, identifying competitors, gaps, and trends to inform strategic decisions on journal growth.
Fostered relationships with Editors-in-Chief and researchers worldwide to develop long-term scientific editorial projects.
Conceptualized vision and visual prototype for a new social-driven platform to accelerate knowledge sharing.











09/2022 - 08/2023


Journal Specialist


Remote, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Developed guidelines and project templates, reducing journal content development time and improving quality checks.
Crafted GPT prompts to streamline quality checks and accelerate the process of developing editorial projects.
Managed CRM databases for three journals, optimizing communication and stakeholder interactions.
Implemented task management boards using Jira Work Management, increasing my team’s productivity.



















Jagiellonian University


10/2016 - 09/2022


Scientist


Kraków, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Leveraged advanced statistical methods, and tidyverse R packages for data analysis, wrangling, and visualization.
Published eight scholarly publications in top-tier journals.
Co-designed three long-term laboratory experiments and secured funding from two research grants.
Coordinated international collaboration with researchers from Germany, USA, and Poland to streamline data collection, financial management, and analysis of the research outcomes.
Presented award-winning posters and oral presentations at six international conferences.
Taught undergraduate-level courses and mentored master-level students to finalize their research and thesis.



















Max Planck Institute for Biological Intelligence


07/2020 - 12/2021


Visiting Researcher


Seewiesen, Germany


details 







Achievements:

Led the design, organization, and analysis of an interdisciplinary research project.
Developed, tested, and validated a measurement system prototype, reducing data acquisition costs by 10 times.



















University of Rhode Island


01/2019 - 02/2019


Visiting Researcher


Kingston, RI, USA


details 







Achievements:

Presented my doctoral research at SICB 2019, an international conference held in Tampa, Florida.
Expanded professional network by establishing connections with leading researchers in my field.
Conducted analyses of research data and drafted article manuscript for the next article.











Other 











Drukarnia Transfer


10/2015 - 09/2016


Graphic designer / DTP


Kraków, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Designed diverse visual assets including logotypes, social media graphics, brochures, and flyers.
Managed desktop publishing tasks and engaged in customer communication, enhancing graphic design skills.
Presented research at the international conference Biomedical Basis of Elite Performance 2016 held in Nottingham, UK, mastering effective communication and sharing findings with a global audience.



















Grupa Unity


05/2014 - 10/2014


Graphic designer


Kraków, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Created impactful visual assets including logos and social media graphics.
Maintained WordPress-based webpages, ensuring visual appeal and up-to-date content.
Collaborated on successful marketing campaigns and optimized graphics for improved user engagement.



















Jagiellonian University


08/2012 - 05/2014


Laboratory Technician


Kraków, Poland


details 







Achievements:

Managed long-term experimental evolution project overseeing a large laboratory population of bank voles.
Executed experiments, and collaborated with students and researchers, gaining insights into experimental methodologies and data analysis techniques.
Developed skills in attention to detail, data organization, and management, laying the foundation for a researcher mindset.

education















Jagiellonian University


2019 - 2021


Jagiellonian Interdisciplinary PhD Programme


Kraków, Poland


details 







About the programme:

The Program was an elite form of support for PhD students who wished to expand their research skills, increase their scientific and professional potential, and familiarize themselves with research practices in other areas and disciplines of science.

Achievements:

Organized abroad an interdisciplinary research project conducted at the Max Planck Institute for Biological Intelligence (former Ornithology)



















Jagiellonian University


2016 - 2023


Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Life sciences


Kraków, Poland


details 







Dissertation:

A berry a day keeps the costs away? The physiological effects of dietary anthocyanins in a migratory songbird, European starling (Sturnus vulgaris)

Scholarships:

2020 - PhD scholarship for best students issued by Rector of Jagiellonian University
2016, 2018, 2020 - PhD scholarship for best students issued by the Dean of Faculty of Biology of Jagiellonian University

Awards:

2019 - Award for best poster presentation at Polish Evolutionary Converence 2019, Gdańsk, PL
2018 - Award for best oral presentation - runner up - at Polish Evolutionary Converence 2018, Warsaw, PL

Grants:

2019 - Grant for PhD research: Linking variation in the cell size to the rate of metabolism at different level of biological organization (~23k PLN)
2017 - Grant for PhD research: Rate of oxygen consumption at three levels of biological organization in bank voles selected for increased aerobic metabolism: pilot studies (~25k PLN)



















Jagiellonian University


2013 - 2015


Master of Science (MSc), Biology


Kraków, Poland


details 







Dissertation:

Effect of selection and endurance training on maximum rate of exercise metabolism in bank voles

Scholarships:

2014 - Scholarship for best students issued by the Dean of Faculty of Biology of Jagiellonian University



















Jagiellonian University


2010 - 2013

Kraków, Poland

title: hi, I’m Maciej
text:
Thanks for popping into my little corner of the internet!I’m a scientist and data analyst with background in life sciences, and I love diving into data to uncover valuable insights. For over eight years, I collaborated on international research projects, and I’ve dedicated two years to the world of open-access scholarly publishing. My career goal is simple: to empower teams and make smarter, data-driven decisions together.
Learn more about me → Let’s have a chat! →

    
    
  



who am I?

      (Click to see the details)
    
  














I analyse data
My doctorate research has equipped me with hands-on experience in both exploratory and statistical analysis. I’m skilled in R, SQL, and spreadsheets, and I enjoy tinkering with visualizations - to craft a narrative driven by data insights.


My projects 












My academicresearch 



I solve problems
Life and professional challenges often have diverse solutions, and I’m striving to find optimal ones. Experienced in research methodologies I know how to approach challenges systematically and with a creative mindset.





I break out (of my expertise bubble)
Having experience in interdisciplinary projects, I like to push myself out of my comfort zone. This helped me to develop a cost-effective measurement system prototype and also provide empirical evidence for a long-standing hypothesis in my research field.











I’m inspired by innovative ideas
Working as a publishing specialist, I recognized an opportunity for innovation within my company. Outside of my work, I conceptualized a vision and developed a visual prototype to address this gap. After presentation to my colleagues, the prototype garnered positive feedback and progressed into further development by the product team.





I’m collaborative.
Believing in the power of teamwork, I thrive on cross-functional collaboration, appreciating feedback from every team member. I simply believe that important decisions should never be made in a silo.











I extend support
Throughout my publishing journey, my focus has been on empowering researchers to amplify their work, disseminate knowledge, and break down publishing barriers at a scale. I strategically developed content for three scholarly journals and built numerous relationships with researchers worldwide, spanning from early-career to senior professionals.





I’m upskilling
Practice serves as my primary way of learning - a pathway to mastery. In my spare time, I dive into analytical projects, not only to broaden my skill set but also to refine my craft. I’m also enthusiastic about exploring a range of topics beyond data analysis, including parenting, productivity, and science.
